intro: Cacalia thyrsoidea, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads, aiding in wind pollination. Its foliage is lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
